task.title: Installing JDK (Java Development Kit)
task.shortdesc: Java Development Kit (JDK) is a Sun product targeted for Java developers. You can use it to write, compile, debug, and run Java applets and applications.

step.cmd: From the Sun Developer Network page, scroll to find the heading J2SE v 1.4.2_08 SDK
From the Sun Developer Network page, accept the license agreement and scroll to the heading "Linux Platform - Java(TM) 2 SDK, Standard Edition 1.4.2_08"
Select and download RPM in self-extracting file .
Run and install into a Linux home directory.
Set the environment variable for JAVA_HOME.
